alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Washington and central Clarke Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 628 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Saint Stephens, or 8 miles northeast of Chatom, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy and Millry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
